thread.title: Detroit Lions Tweak Their Logo — Again [PHOTO]
thread.title_full: Detroit Lions Tweak Their Logo — Again [PHOTO]

author: CBS Detroit
title: Detroit Lions Tweak Their Logo — Again [PHOTO]
text:
Detroit Lions Tweak Their Logo — Again [PHOTO] February 1, 2017 9:45 AM OAKLAND, CA - AUGUST 15: Detroit Lions helmets sit on the sideline during their preseason game against the Oakland Raiders at O.co Coliseum on August 15, 2014 in Oakland, California. (Photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images) 
By: Evan Jankens 
When the Detroit Lions debuted their new logo in 2009 they decided to add black to the outline of the Lion. 
Now it appears the organization has decided to remove the black and replace it with silver. #lions make a change to their logo pic.twitter.com/2JtUEIJrf3 
— Evan Jankens (@KINGoftheKC) February 1, 2017 
The new logo appears on the Detroit Lions website . Does that mean there won’t be black on the Lions uniforms anymore? It appears that might be the case. Great idea! If they keep going, maybe no one will recognize the team that has failed its fans over and over. 
— Detroit Lions (@Lions) February 1, 2017 
Last season Detroit Lions president Rod Wood did say the team would look at their entire uniform as well as the scheme and look. This looks like the first step. 
Also will this change the Color Rush uniforms the Lions will wear this season? 
Do you like the change the team made?
